name: Homewood Suites Princeton

reviews.text: What an incredible surprise! We went to Princeton for reunions weekend. Other hotels were quoting us $250 a night. I booked this hotel for us and another couple, and was terrified I had made a mistake. Boy, how wrong could I be!!! The hotel looked brand new. It was stunning -- the rooms were big, beautiful, luxurious, with the famous Hilton beds you never want to get out of. It was quiet, quiet, quiet. Breakfast was eggs, breads, french toast, meat, juices, coffee -- a full breakfast. We paid $121 on Thursday night and $75 on Fri. and Sat. The other couple is insisting I book all of their vacation hotels now.
reviews.title: I looked like a genius!

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and enjoyed every minute of it! The hotel was extremely clean, had a very friendly staff, and provided an excellent hot buffet breakfast every morning. The kitchen in the suite worked out really well since we have a three-month old and need to clean/sterilize bottles as well as have a refrigerator to store them in. The beds felt clean and were some of the softest we've ever stayed in!
reviews.title: Everything we Needed!

reviews.text: No plans to ever visit Princeton again (can't stand how the street system worked and we only visited due to a wedding), but I would definitely recommend the Homewood Suites!
reviews.title: This hotel failed me

likes.disliked: — Lack of reliability on advertised services

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel, but the management is poor. I was promised a free shuttle service from the railway station, and in fact I went to a lot of trouble to get to Princeton Junction. I will admit my train was delayed, and I was not able to make my initial meeting with the shuttle, but I rang and updated them at least four times. Then when I finally got there, catching a train from Trenton (the most dangerous city in the USA), I was told that they could not collect me, and that I would have to catch a cab. In the end I got ripped off by an illicit cab driver and just paid an inflated rate (no meter) because I did not want to cross someone who could be dangerous. So I was hours delayed to make use of the shuttle (which my rather poor company insisted I not use taxis). To make matters worse, the front desk is understaffed and there are delays in check in. I spoke with the manager, Carlos Santana who indicated that they would not pay for the cab. Although he was polite, he was not prepared to make this customer less disgruntled. My advice is do not rely on this hotel to do anything.
reviews.title: Fantastic choice near Princeton University

reviews.text: I shouldn't be surprised that the Homewood Suites were so nice, given other TripAdvisor reviews, but honestly it was nicer than I expected. I got a great rate for a suite with a full kitchen. The room was pretty luxurious; the bathroom was spacious and clean and the whole place seems to have been redecorated recently. The free breakfast buffet was hearty -- not just bread and juice as at some other places. There were two breakfast entrees with hot side orders each day, plus the usual assortment of cereals, breads, pastries. An unexpected plus was that they offer a free dinnertime meal (buffet style again) on weekdays, although I didn't take advantage of this. The staff members were all helpful, the place was immaculately clean and well-kept up. I can't think of anything negative to say about the place. In fact, I the rooms were a lot nicer and certainly more spacious than those in the nearby Hyatt, which is much more expensive and doesn't include breakfast or complimentary wireless internet. Overall: don't hesitate to stay at the Homewood if you're visiting Princeton.
reviews.title: They charged me and cancelled my reservation

reviews.text: I was just at Princeton, taking my daughter to check out grad school and attend her Admitted Student Open House. This property showed up on my search. Never stayed in a Homewood Suite, but due to the good rate and close proximity to the campus, decided to give it a try. In short, I think this is a superb place to stay, if visiting the area. Reasons:
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay very much!

reviews.text: 1. Very adequate breakfast
reviews.title: CLEAN, QUIET & COMFY!!

reviews.text: 2. Very adequate dinner M-Th nights. Since there's not much dining choices around, it's nice that they serve a complementary dinner with salad, entree, simple dessert and beer/wine.
reviews.title: Consistently good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Free shuttle (very friendly morning driver) to and from surrounding areas from 9:30AM to 10PM (I think that's the schedule). It was mostly reliable, but was late once picking us up near Princeton by about 20 minutes. The shuttle driver was very apologetic. I was OK with that since it was sunny and warm, but would not be that great if it was cold and rainy.
reviews.title: Great hotel better then any 4 star hotels

reviews.text: 4. The rooms are very clean, spacious and has a kitchenette, which we used quite a bit.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I have been staying here for several weeks while working in the area and the staff is always very helpful and eager to provide the small comforts that distinguish a "place to stay" from a hotel. David in the breakfast area is a pleasure as is Wyatt on the desk in the evenings. Thanks for sevral great stays
reviews.title: Great Hotel for an extended stay

reviews.text: Lots of places on US 1 to stay, so decided to give this one a try. Very nice property and got upgrated to a 2 bedroom suite. Too bad I was by myself ;-)
reviews.title: Excellent Property

reviews.text: Would certainly stay here again when in the area.
reviews.title: HEAT the pool

reviews.text: I brought my kids for a weekend getaway. The hottub was luke warm, the pool was ICE cold.
reviews.title: Worth a stay in Princeton.

reviews.text: Everything else at this place was great, but, my kids love to swim and use the hot tub.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, also for families.

reviews.text: We were looking for a reasonably nice place for a weekend visit to Six Flags, since we were planning an afternoon/night visit and a morning/afternoon visit to the park.
reviews.title: You sometimes get what you pay for - but be careful -stinkbugs

reviews.text: The hotel had offered a great rate, and since it included what turned out to be a rather nice breakfast buffet, it was worth driving a little more to get here - having 4 teenagers with me, I wanted a quiet night sleep.
reviews.title: HORRIBLE Service

reviews.text: They "upgraded" me to change my reservation to a larger room, but changed it to a smoking room - without telling me anything. I happened to be re-checking directions and noticed the reservation was not what we had made - so I had to call and make sure I had the room I reserved. They tried to tell me "people hardly ever smoke there" so I had to insist.
reviews.title: Feels a little more upscale than most Homewood Suites.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked in - fairly late - they gave us the room we reserved. This incident didn't make me all that comfortable in their reservation system if they would put non-smokers in a smoking room - so guests should be warned they have to check to see if the hotel changed something without telling you.
reviews.title: A great staff!

reviews.text: There was what I later learned was a stinkbug on the bed. Gross. I was told that they are common all over Southern Jersey this time of year. Does that excuse a bug on the bed? Everything else was spit spot.
reviews.title: Great family experience

reviews.text: Traveling to Princeton for a wedding, we booked two rooms for our party of 4 plus baby. We arrived on the rainiest night I can remember. After driving 4 hours in the rain, the Homewood Suites Princeton was an oasis of calm, warmth, and accommodation. We were greeted with a roaring fire upon entering the lobby, and with a warm greeting from the nice woman working the front desk. She smiled at my baby, my baby smiled at her, and we relaxed. We were shown a room that was some way from my in-laws room, and went to the desk to see if a change was possible. Instantly, our room was changed to a room across the aisle from my in-laws, and we were given a two room suite to boot.
reviews.title: Could not have been HAPPIER, great stay
Poor service from management
reviews.text: All the rooms were clean, and the beds comfortable. The full size kitchen with full size fridge was appreciated by a nursing mom with bottles of milk to keep fresh. It being such a rainy nasty night, we were happy to be able to cook in and rest from our drive. We had all the dishes and cookware were needed to make a nice dinner. Again, a full size stove is a nice touch for a family with children. The buffet breakfast in the morning was complete, and a nice touch. The happy gentleman working the station accommodated our requests with a pleasant smile.

I cannot say enough about the two ladies working the front desk. We stayed over the weekend From Feb 1 to Feb 4, and they were always there to greet us and chuckle over my baby (always a crowd pleaser with me).
reviews.title: Poor Service at Check-in

reviews.text: We had a wonderful little family vacation, and the hotel exceeded our expectations. We will go again.
reviews.title: Passable but you can do better...

reviews.text: Let me begin my review by explaining that this was my first stay at a Homewood Suites by Hilton so I was not sure what to expect. I was on a last minute business trip and only needed to stay for 1 night. I picked this hotel primarily due to the price and location.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable for a Great Price

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the entire hotel and the size of my suite (kitchen, living room, and bedroom). There is plenty of space for an entire family. Additionally the work out center was big and contained a lot of different types of equipment. We all enjoyed the added amenities such as free internet, free hot breakfast (much more than the typical cold pastries and fruit that most hotels offer), and the free hot food and beer/wine on each weekday night. Overall we were all very surprised most by these amenities.
reviews.title: No waffles?

reviews.text: I stay at homewood suites often with my family due to the great value. I stayed at the Princeton location on business and it overall is an average homewood. My two issues: my room had a sulfur like smell each time I entered it. I blew it off as a local water issue. What motivated me to write this review was the lack of waffles on the included breakfast. I have found homewoods to be hit or miss on having the waffles which is concerning given they pioneered this option years ago and now most every mid tier chain throws in the free waffles. The issue here was the waffle maker was not cooking the waffle and when I notified the attendant she simply sniffed at the waffle maker and then vanished to the back not to return?! I grabbed a banana and two oranges and called it a wrap.
reviews.title: Will return when in the area.

reviews.text: This is a nice, clean, friendly hotel--although the last couple times I have stayed here there has been a large group of guys always standing right outside the parking lot doors smoking like there is no tomorrow. The suite is 2 separate rooms with a full kitchen/refrigerator. The weekday evening "meal" is a nice snack with a glass of wine but don't expect fine cuisine. The hot tub beside the indoor pool was nice the first night. I wasn't able to enjoy it again as it was not warm/hot the remaining 3 nights of my stay. The location isn't far from downtown Princeton and the University for nice shopping and dining.
reviews.title: Perfect Night? I think So!

reviews.text: Here's what a family of 4 is looking for, a good clean room in a quiet hotel for a reasonable price. This property was just that, we enjoyed our free meal that night and complimentary breakfast that morning. Staff was friendly and courteous. 1 Bedroom King Suite was spacious and well appointed. We used the onsite laundry to catch up on dirty clothes and it was great. Pool and spa area were well kept, clean and modern. A few pool toys were left for our kids to enjoy!
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent HS property - clean and welcoming. All the staff we came across were helpful and pleasant during our 4 nights here. Easy access into Princeton and onto Route 1 too - makes it really useful for those travelling through or those wishing to spend time the area.
reviews.title: Excellent clean hotel - convenient for lots in NJ
Great Hotel
reviews.text: We had a king suite which came with a large bed (great linens) and a large kitchen. Bathroom was kept immaculately clean as was the rest of the suite. The included breakfast was fine - hot items plus other bakery stuff and cereals - all kept well stocked and the food area was clean too.

Public areas were quite lovely (lobby, gym, pool) and the breakfast area was very restful - although it was Labor Day weekend, the hotel wasn't noisy and we didn't even hear any noise from Route 1 - quite impressive. Didn't have a problem with the air con - which was essential given the daily temperatures!
reviews.title: Great Ammeneties, Great Service, Wonderful complimentary Breakfast AND Dinner

likes.liked: — The Staff had a great attitude and some meals were included and were high quality.
likes.disliked: — Size of our unit, and A/C in the units and the building.

reviews.text: If you are looking for a reasonable rate (we paid $119 per night) in a new, spacious and CLEAN hotel - book this one. I would book it again if I was in the area.
reviews.title: priceteen

reviews.text: We went to the area for a wedding and really loved the hotel. Very clean, close to downtown Princeton and train to New York. Breakfast was great and well stocked. The only thing was that one of the days we called for maid service and no one came. The front desk was very accommodating though. Great internet lab and snack room. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

description: The Homewood Suites by Hilton® Princeton is conveniently located just 4 miles from Historic Princeton University and the Princeton Battlefield in Princeton, New Jersey. Visit our hotel and enjoy full breakfast each morning, evening dinner & drinks and complimentary high-speed internet access. Whatever the reason for your visit, relax and keep in shape at our fitness center, indoor pool & basketball court. Explore many Princeton area attractions just steps from our centrally located hotel.
